siteMetadata.title: GDST Docs
siteMetadata.description: A guide to GFTC's recommended standards and APIs

children.value:
The Aquaculture (Farmed) BUL tables are broken up into supply chain
roles: Processor, Farm, Hatchery, and Feed. Because of space
limitations, they are broken up by: KDE Definition, Data Format,
Standards Data List and Standards Organization, and List Link,
Authoritative Data Source, and Authoritative Data Document.

properties.ariaLabel: table 4 aquaculture processor kde definition data format standard data list and standards organization permalink

children.value: Table 4: Aquaculture Processor KDE Definition, Data Format, Standard Data List, and Standards Organization
To be completed in conjunction with WG2
ASFIS List of Species for Fishery Statistics Purposes
FAO Fisheries and Aquaculture Statistics and Information Branch (FIAS)
Commercial short-hand reference of the degree of transformation of seafood from its original living form.
To be completed in conjunction with WG2
Calendar date of last point of processing or packaging.
To be completed in conjunction with WG2
Identifier associated with physical product marking a particular instance of seafood material such as a batch number, purchase order, or container number
To be completed in conjunction with WG2
(Individual facility / supply chain actor in most cases)
Business name of entity that last transformed the product into semi-processed, processed or end product
To be completed in conjunction with WG2
Latin Alphabet, numbers and punctuation - ISO 7-bit coded character set for information interchange (ISO/IEC 646:1991)
Unique indicator generated by the authorities in the country of operation that gives the processor the license to operate.
Country where seafood underwent the last substantial transformation.
To be completed in conjunction with WG2
Numerically quantifiable amount of seafood with a standard Unit of Measure.
To be completed in conjunction with WG2
Recommendation No. 20, Codes for Units of Measure Used in International Trade
UN Centre for Trade Facilitation and E-business (UN/CEFACT)
Standard for measurement of the product
To be completed in conjunction with WG2
Recommendation No. 20, Codes for Units of Measure Used in International Trade
UN Centre for Trade Facilitation and E-business (UN/CEFACT)
Identifier of seafood material to distinguish it within a particular facility, company, or globally.
To be completed in conjunction with WG2
Business name under which the farm is licensed to operate.
To be completed in conjunction with WG2
Latin Alphabet, numbers and punctuation - ISO 7-bit coded character set for information interchange (ISO/IEC 646:1991)
Unique indicator generated by the authorities in the country of operation that gives the farm the license to operate.
To be completed in conjunction with WG2
GPS Coordinates according to ISO's Standard representation of geographic point location by coordinates
GPS Coordinates - International Organization for Standardization (ISO)
The name of the company or person collecting harvest from multiple farms in order to distribute to an entity down the supply chain
To be completed in conjunction with WG2
Latin Alphabet, numbers and punctuation - ISO 7-bit coded character set for information interchange (ISO/IEC 646:1991)
Unique indicator generated by the authorities in the country of operation that gives the aggregator the license to operate.
name of standards body which a particular seafood is subject to and the unique identifier associated with the certified entity.
name of chain of custody standards body which particular seafood is subject to and the unique identifier associated with the certified entity.

properties.ariaLabel: table 5 aquaculture processor listreference link authoritative data source and authoritative data document permalink

children.value: Table 5: Aquaculture Processor List/Reference Link, Authoritative Data Source, and Authoritative Data Document
Person within a production or processing facility with the responsibility of accurately recording the product transformation
Person within a production or processing facility with the responsibility of accurately recording the date(s) of production
Person at a scale, on a production line or other place with the responsibility of recording an reference number linking the product to the last CTE
Weight ticket, production records, packing lists, purchase order, container number, etc.
Registry of Authorized Food Processing Facilities
National or local-level lists. Decision from TG to request authorized sources to make lists accessible online for verification purposes - Q46
Registry of Authorized Food Processing Facilities
Customs authority of the relevant exporting or production country
Certificate(s) of origin from relevant customs authority
Person at a scale, on a production line or other place with the responsibility of recording an accurate weight of the product
Weight ticket, production records, packing lists etc.
Person at a scale, on a production line or other place with the responsibility of recording an accurate weight of the product
Weight ticket, production records, packing lists etc.
Person at a scale, on a production line or other place with the responsibility of recording an accurate weight of the product
Weight ticket, production records, packing lists etc.
Aquaculture Regulatory Authority - assuming it is indicated on those records
Standards body which holds the intellectual property of the standard and is responsible for its revision
Respective registry of the standards body
Standards body which holds the intellectual property of the standard and is responsible for its revision
Respective registry of the standards body

properties.ariaLabel: table 6 aquaculture farm kde definition data format standard data list and standards organization permalink

children.value: Table 6: Aquaculture Farm KDE Definition, Data Format, Standard Data List, and Standards Organization
Individual growing area to which a specific license appls; will be comprised of several ponds, pens, tanks
Latin Alphabet, numbers and punctuation - ISO 7-bit coded character set for information interchange (ISO/IEC 646:1991)https://www.iso.org/standard/4777.html?browse=tc
Calendar date on which the seafood was harvested from the farm/cultivation area
To be completed in conjunction with WG2
A combination of type of culture, unit, level of intensity, culture species and scale or size of exploitation as defined by the FAO.
FAO's Aquaculture Methods and Practices or EU's Common Fisheries Policy, AquacultureMethods
FAO or EU (GDST could author a list)
Name of feed manufacturer including in-house sources
Latin Alphabet, numbers and punctuation - ISO 7-bit coded character set for information interchange (ISO/IEC 646:1991)
Name of company that supplied the fry/fingerlings to farm for grow out, including in-house sourced
Latin Alphabet, numbers and punctuation - ISO 7-bit coded character set for information interchange (ISO/IEC 646:1991)https://www.iso.org/standard/4777.html?browse=tc
Unique indicator generated by the authorities in the country of operation that gives the hatchery the license to operate.
Identifier associated with physical product marking a particular instance of seafood material such as a batch number, purchase order, or container number
To be completed in conjunction with WG2
(Individual facility / supply chain actor in most cases)
name of standards body which a particular seafood is subject to and the unique identifier associated with the certified entity.
name of chain of custody standards body which particular seafood is subject to and the unique identifier associated with the certified entity.

children.value: Table 7: Aquaculture Farm List Link, Authoritative Data Source, and Authoritative Data Document
Aquaculture Regulatory Authority - assuming it is indicated on those records - or farm business owner
Aquaculture business public register or farm records
Grow out site tracking record/ Harvest record/Sales/purchase/delivery order
Grow out site tracking record/ Harvest record/Sales/purchase/delivery order
Person at a scale, on a production line or other place with the responsibility of recording an accurate weight of the product
Weight ticket, production records, packing lists etc.
Standards body which holds the intellectual property of the standard and is responsible for its revision
Respective registry of the standards body
Standards body which holds the intellectual property of the standard and is responsible for its revision
Respective registry of the standards body

properties.ariaLabel: table 8 aquaculture hatchery kde definition data format standard data list and standards organization permalink

children.value: Table 8: Aquaculture Hatchery KDE Definition, Data Format, Standard Data List, and Standards Organization
To be completed in conjunction with WG2
ASFIS List of Species for Fishery Statistics Purposes
FAO Fisheries and Aquaculture Statistics and Information Branch (FIAS)
Name of company that supplied the fry/fingerlings to farm for grow out, including in-house sourced
Latin Alphabet, numbers and punctuation - ISO 7-bit coded character set for information interchange (ISO/IEC 646:1991) https://www.iso.org/standard/4777.html?browse=tc
Unique indicator generated by the authorities in the country of operation that gives the hatchery the license to operate.
Country where the hatchery is operating
GPS coordinates of the hatchery that supplied the fry/fingerlings
To be completed in conjunction with WG2
GPS Coordinates according to ISO's Standard representation of geographic point location by coordinates
GPS Coordinates - International Organization for Standardization (ISO)
Date on which fingerlngs were transferred to the grow out farm/pond
Broodstock from grow-out farms or taken from the wild

Broodstock are either produced domestically or sourced from the wild. Unless there is a need for more granularity in the describing the sources of broodstock, we recommend 'domestic' or 'wild sourced' are the data options
Identifier associated with physical product marking a particular instance of seafood material such as a batch number, purchase order, or container number
To be completed in conjunction with WG2
(Individual facility / supply chain actor in most cases)
name of standards body which a particular seafood is subject to and the unique identifier associated with the certified entity.
name of chain of custody standards body which particular seafood is subject to and the unique identifier associated with the certified entity.

children.value: Table 9: Aquaculture Hatchery List Link, Authoritative Data Source, and Authoritative Data Document
Possibly regulatory authority if included on Hatchery registration record
Feedmill construction records / GPS device readout
Person at a scale, on a production line or other place with the responsibility of recording an reference number linking the product to a batch
Weight ticket, production records, packing lists, purchase order, container number, etc.
Standards body which holds the intellectual property of the standard and is responsible for its revision
Respective registry of the standards body
Standards body which holds the intellectual property of the standard and is responsible for its revision

properties.ariaLabel: table 10 aquaculture feed kde definition data format standard data list and standards organization permalink

children.value: Table 10: Aquaculture Feed KDE Definition, Data Format, Standard Data List, and Standards Organization
Name of feed manufacturer including in-house sources
To be completed in conjunction with WG2
Latin Alphabet, numbers and punctuation - ISO 7-bit coded character set for information interchange (ISO/IEC 646:1991)https://www.iso.org/standard/4777.html?browse=tc
Business name of entity that last transformed the feed into end product
To be completed in conjunction with WG2
Latin Alphabet, numbers and punctuation - ISO 7-bit coded character set for information interchange (ISO/IEC 646:1991)https://www.iso.org/standard/4777.html?browse=tc
Unique indicator generated by the authorities in the country of operation that gives the feedmill the license to operate.
GPS Coordinates of feedmill where feeds were manufactured
To be completed in conjunction with WG2
GPS Coordinates according to ISO's Standard representation of geographic point location by coordinates
GPS Coordinates - International Organization for Standardization (ISO)
source(s) of protein in formulation of feed used
Latin Alphabet, numbers and punctuation - ISO 7-bit coded character set for information interchange (ISO/IEC 646:1991)https://www.iso.org/standard/4777.html?browse=tc
Identifier associated with physical product marking a particular instance of seafood material such as a batch number, purchase order, or container number
To be completed in conjunction with WG2
(Individual facility / supply chain actor in most cases)
name of harvest standards body which the source(s) of protein used in the feed is subject to and the unique identifier associated with the certified entity.
name of chain of custody standards body which particular harvest seafood is subject to and the unique identifier associated with the certified entity.

properties.ariaLabel: table 11 aquaculture feed list link authoritative data source and authoritative data document permalink

children.value: Table 11: Aquaculture Feed List Link Authoritative Data Source, and Authoritative Data Document
Aquaculture/Animal Feed Authority for feed manufacturers and for in-house sources if an approval system exists
Public register of feedmills/farm feed documents for in-house feeds
Feedmill supervisor/owner (Possibly regulatory authority if they included GPS coordinates)
Feedmill construction records / GPS device readout
Feeds ingredients list/ Certificate of origin of wild caught byproduct /sales order/delivery order
Person at a scale, on a production line or other place with the responsibility of recording a reference number linking the product to a batch
Weight ticket, production records, packing lists, purchase order, container number, etc.
Standards body which holds the intellectual property of the standard and is responsible for its revision
Respective registry of the standards body
Standards body which holds the intellectual property of the standard and is responsible for its revision
Respective registry of the standards body

pages.title: Documentation Home
pages.description: Explore the Global Dialogue on Seafood Traceability Documentation GitHub

pages.title: Feedback and Caveats
pages.description: Process, known issues, caveats and feedback requested.

pages.title: How to Use this Documentation
pages.description: This is a quick guide on how we hope people to use this documentation.

pages.title: Why EPCIS?
pages.description: Here is page that covers why we chose EPCIS as the interoperable data format standard.

pages.title: Master Data
pages.description: This page contains example master data that is used in events recorded for products harvested from the wild.

pages.title: Feeding
pages.description: Covers event data that is recorded around the feeding of products while they are being grown at an aquaculture facility.

pages.title: Wild to Farmed
pages.description: This covers scenarios where products are harvested from the wild to stock an aquaculture facility. Then those products are harvested from the aquaculture facility when they are ready for commerical use.

pages.title: Commodities
pages.description: How to handle the different scenarios across the diverse amount of commodities.

pages.title: XML Mappings
pages.description: These are ECPIS XML Mappings from GDST KDEs to the exact XPath in the EPCIS Event XML. These XPaths start from the base of the <ObjectEvent>, <TransformationEvent>, and <AggregateEvent> XML elements.

pages.title: Advanced Scenario - Hatchery and Salmon Farm (w/ Feeding and Treatments)
pages.description: This scenario covers if you have traceability back to the Hatchery the Hatchery. It also includes examples of how to record long running transformations, feeding, and treatments.

pages.title: Master Data
pages.description: This page contains example master data that is used in events recorded for products harvested from the wild.

pages.title: Fishing Event
pages.description: This page covers information about capturing the Fishing / Wild Harvest event.

pages.title: On Vessel Processing
pages.description: This page covers information about capturing events in regards to On-Vessel Processing.

pages.title: TransShipment
pages.description: How to record the Landing events given different scenarios.

pages.title: Landing
pages.description: How to record the Landing events given different scenarios.

pages.title: Gear Types
pages.description: How to record events based on the different gear types used.

pages.title: Commodities
pages.description: How to handle the different scenarios across the diverse amount of commodities.

pages.title: XML Mappings
pages.description: These are ECPIS XML Mappings from GDST KDEs to the exact XPath in the EPCIS Event XML.

pages.title: Advanced Scenario - Multiple Fishing Vessels with Transshipment
pages.description: In this scenario we are going to cover what happens when you have multiple fishing vessels that are transshipped by the same transshipment vessel and then offloaded, shipped, and received by a processor.

pages.title: Business Steps
pages.description: This covers all the additional Business Steps added by GDST to cover specific event scenarios in Seafood Traceability.

pages.title: Dispositions
pages.description: This covers how Dispositions have been extended to support Seafood Traceability needs.

pages.title: Certificates
pages.description: This covers how Certificates have been extended including Certificate Types and where Certificates can be added.

pages.title: Vessel Catch Area
pages.description: This covers how the Vessel Catch Area is extended by GDST.

pages.title: Master Data
pages.description: These are additional attributes required by the Basic Universal List which are encoded in EPCIS Master Data.

pages.title: ILMD
pages.description: This covers how the ILMD attributes have been extended to support the needs to of Seafood Traceability.

pages.title: Object Event
pages.description: This covers how the Object Event type has been extended to support Seafood Traceability.

pages.title: Full Chain Capability Test
pages.description: This is documentation that covers how to use the capability tool for full-chain capability.

pages.title: Featured implementations
pages.description: A list of project implemented GDST standard

pages.title: Edit documentation
pages.description: How to work on this documentation

pages.title: Request documentation
pages.description: How to submit a request for new documentation

pages.title: Peer review
pages.description: How to submit your edit for review and merge

pages.title: Running Gatsby Locally
pages.description: A quick tutorial on running the Gatsby server locally for testing branches.

pages.title: Contributors
pages.description: List of those involved, in alphabetical order.

pages.title: Contacts
pages.description: List of contacts in case of inquiry.
